website_summaries.verdict: A good quality soft-sided suitcase that isn't as expensive as many other brands.
pros: Available in 5 different colors, 2 different sizes, and 3 different sets
Includes tie-down straps, mesh pockets, and deep shoe pockets
Handles and zippers are good quality for the price
cons: Can be hard to maneuver when fully packed

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: This is a terrible, unreliable, crappily-made bag. We bought it in October, went on an international trip and by the last leg, the pull handle was stuck in the upright position and the bag had ripped on the side with another handle. By the time the bag was pulled off the plane on the last leg, the pull handle had snapped off completely. On our other identical bag, the handle next to the pull handle broke when a taxi driver lifted it out of his vehicle. The pull handle on that bag was sticking from the moment we began using it. DO NOT BUY! You cannot get a refund, only a replacement. I would never buy this brand again.
customer_reviews.author: Erin G.

customer_reviews.title: -good size for quality - well made - came with lock -has great depth space (deep) for more room - looks nice ...
customer_reviews.text: Giving this product 5 stars. Pros if it: -good size for quality - well made - came with lock -has great depth space (deep) for more room - looks nice - can hold quite a bit - suit case is light Cons: -the lock is the cheapest quality and not worth even putting on your case. my 2 year old could probably get past it if he wanted to! - it's not super high quality pretty fast, it'll wear out of you use it all the time. But again, for the price it's not bad.
customer_reviews.author: CGie

customer_reviews.title: only received the larger peice
customer_reviews.text: Please help. First off The larger luggage net pocket has rips in it and I DID NOT RECEIVE the smaller luggage. What to do This is an update, I originally rated a one star due to not receiving full order and the ripped interior of luggage. I rated, asked for a replacement and within 5 min. I heard they immediately shipped out the replacement and I did receive my two piece replacement within two days and in great condition. I really love this set, well worth the money and the measurements are exactly what I need for my Spirit flight. Thank you for your speedy replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: I guess you pay for what you get.
customer_reviews.text: After one non-stop flight to Hawaii. The luggage material is already showing heavy signs of use. These luggage set show a 5 year wear in a one trip usage. Material fraying and broken metal nranding logos. Would not recommend and not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Yafed Xiong

customer_reviews.title: Handle won’t retract
customer_reviews.text: The small suitcase in this set has a defective handle. On its second outing, the handle extended for pushing, and now will not completely retract. I unzipped the interior to see if i could work with it, and several other people including taxi drivers have tried to fix it, to no avail. I am not planning on taking this back home because it will not make it through the airport check-in in this condition. The suitcase is not functional and unusable. I had to purchase a suitcase at a store in Nagasaki in order to continue my travels. I will gladly amend my review, once an adequate solution is resolved.
customer_reviews.author: Jeannee Stevens

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size, great set of features
customer_reviews.text: We had a suitcase like this for several years (probably 250,000 air miles) and were thrilled when we found the same one still available. The 25 inch size is larger than carry-on, but two of us can travel for over a week in this one suitcase. There are larger suitcases available, but bulky enough that I only recommend them if you are bringing the kitchen sink.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie in Austin

customer_reviews.title: VERY POOR QUALITY!
customer_reviews.text: Although the set was the correct size and pretty for my trip, the quality of the bags are very poor. Three of the bags did not withstand the trip as this was my first time using them. The carryon came loose at the seam and it was not handled rough at all. Again it was my carryon. Hope the images help someone decide if they want to purchase. I would not recommend purchasing this set. I will be spending money on a set that is a better quality as far as strength is concerned.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality bag with very low durability!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this suitcase less than a year ago and although skeptical that a $55 bag could endure international plane trips decided to buy. It's on it's only 2nd trip now and the handle is difficult to extend. Worse is that the material has torn away from across at the top of the lower zippered pocket. Will certainly donate this bag to my recycling bin when I get back home. Have 17 more days left on this tour and doubt it will survive the 3-flight return trip.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sakas

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money! Very cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Looks good until you use it and it starts to rip at the zippers. Its only a 30 day return and I just got back from my trip using for the first time. I emailed at 31 days and they said I could not return it. Dont waste your money on this item.
customer_reviews.author: Michelle

customer_reviews.title: Buy it; you'll like it.
customer_reviews.text: Well made and quite large. More internal pockets than I can count, and each pocket seems well placed. The outer shell fabric is of very good quallity, and I was surprised how deep the color is. I chose the raspberry/deep red. Fully loaded, the case handle pulls straight and strong, and the wheels appear of good quality. I view this well worth the money and challenge the airline baggage people to crumple this one. Buy it; you'll be happy. I ordered a second one.
customer_reviews.author: Yarburger

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with Purchase
customer_reviews.text: Only paid $40 for the set and am very pleased. Outside pocket of smaller bag fits a 10" tablet. I am flying across the country for a nearly two week stay and plan on not checking in any bags. With concise packing I'm confident I will have room between the two bags to take everything I need. Material and workmanship is pretty durable for soft luggage. After trip... very pleased and happy with my decision to purchase. smaller bag attaches to larger on wheels very nicely. Wheeled through airports/escalators with little effort.
customer_reviews.author: J.P.

customer_reviews.title: I ordered this as an affordable option with plenty of ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this as an affordable option with plenty of space for a move to the UK, and it has served me well thus far. On the move back to the US it was completely crammed to its maximum and very heavy, and it held up well. Its been slashed a bit in travel (due to rough handling) but the seams and wheels have handled the stress.
customer_reviews.author: Allysa

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't stand up to baggage handling on flights.
customer_reviews.text: Back area near where the handle is attached took heavy damage on first flight, needs better\thicker material. Wouldn't purchase again and wish I would have spent more on something better. Fine option for car only travel, but won't stand up to the abuse of baggage handling on flights.
customer_reviews.author: R.P.

customer_reviews.title: First trip got a rip
customer_reviews.text: I was amped about this set and the value of it. However, on its maiden voyage, the carry on bag gained a rip along the expansion seam. I was extremely upset, as I had high hopes for it.. but I supposed it wasn’t meant to be.
customer_reviews.author: Heather Traci

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and Poorly Constucted
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this bag because it fit perfectly in our car for trips. The price was low but since we were not planning on using it for plane trips we expected it to hold up. We have only used the bag 4 times in the past 6 months and on a recent trip to Southern California my wife picked up the bag and the rivet that holds the handle on pulled out and ripped the handle. Overall the bag is constructed nicely but it is very light weight. I cannot imagine how this bag would hold up on a plane trip as the baggage handlers would destroy it.
customer_reviews.author: Drebit

customer_reviews.title: I like the construction but am a little disappointed with the ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because our old suitcases were falling apart. I like the construction but am a little disappointed with the size. I was downsizing from 30" luggage and didn't think dropping down to 26" would be a big deal, since it says expandable. Our old bags were just too big to hold a "packed" suitcase unless I went over the weight limit, which is a reason why I was downsizing. When I went to pack our stuff, I had to sit on suitcase while my son zipped it because it didn't expand like I thought it would. Maybe I just had too high of an expectation. It is a great suitcase and you can't beat the price.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for under $50!
customer_reviews.text: For the price point, this is an excellent price of luggage. This has become my go-to bag. We've used it to travel in both Ireland for 2 weeks), Mexico for a (week), and countless family long weekend stay-cations (family of four for 3 days). It holds A LOT of stuff! Plus, we found it to be a bit more narrow and deep than other 25 inch suitcases, which makes travel travel I bit easier. My only (mirror) complaint is that the front and bottom started showing wear after the first trip. The wear is not interfering with the suitcase's function but does make it look to tad ragged.
customer_reviews.author: DenverWanda

customer_reviews.title: Not for air travel
customer_reviews.text: Stop considering this if you air travel more than once a year. I made the mistake of reading the reviews and believing real travelers are using this product. It is not possible for this to last more than three flights based on the rough handling of luggage by airlines. The sidewall support and material is of thin material. The zippers all feel like they will fail at the next pull. The only redeeming quality is the in-line skate wheels are a better design than spinner wheels.
customer_reviews.author: RMG

customer_reviews.title: Large suitcase at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I read some of the other negative reviews and do not agree. I think for the price point this travel case is a bargain. No broken zippers or tears and it rolls well and is sturdy enough to survive trips to New Mexico. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: John Eluk

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.text: Quite thin material, and the zipper broke upon second use trying to close the bag over a not very large load. If the zipper was stronger, it would not have broken, as the clothing inside was not actually that high a pile and we were pressing down on it very much. Additionally, this bag will NOT stand up straight when full.
customer_reviews.author: Lazar

customer_reviews.title: ... Japan all filled to 50 lbs and they were great. Our previous set had spinner wheels
customer_reviews.text: Took the 3 largest bags to Japan all filled to 50 lbs and they were great. Our previous set had spinner wheels. The old bags would roll away on hills. Last year the airline busted off a spinner wheel on the biggest bag, forcing this purchase. So I wanted inline wheels. They save space too. I bought gray/grey rather than all black. I didn't want to be too flashy, but wanted the bags to be easier to identify in the baggage area. The handles slide up & down easily. The zippers work great. The multiple storage areas and expansion capability are typical, and work well. And the price was very good. I'm very pleased!
customer_reviews.author: R. KLESSIG

customer_reviews.title: Durable suitcase
customer_reviews.text: This is a large, spacious, and reasonably sturdy suitcase. It doesn't have any exciting features, other than a good number of pockets for organizing stuff. However, it has successfully withstood the airline handlers' "attentions" quite a few times without losing any wheels, zippers, etc.. The retractable handle still works. I bought the first one in April 2018 for a family member and it still works so well that I bought a second one in November 2019 for myself. Hopefully it will last for a a few more years, not giving me cause to regret this review.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: BUT LET ME TELL YOU this particular suitcase is sturdy as heck
customer_reviews.text: So I bought this for my trip to Europe back in February. I'm not going to lie, I was low-key worried that this was going to break during my time out the country. BUT LET ME TELL YOU this particular suitcase is sturdy as heck. I've ran through the streets of Paris during a snowstorm with this suitcase. I Walked from Elephant Castle to downtown London with this suitcase, and I have even walked 7 miles to get my hostel in Brussels. This Suitcase has saved my behind by not breaking during my vacation and I am forever grateful! You have a lifetime customer, Travelers Choice.
customer_reviews.author: Karmin Rose.

customer_reviews.title: It's ok but not great
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this suitcase 2.5 times a week since buying it a couple of months ago. I pack a very heavy suitcase and I'm afraid that the wheels are not holding up like I expected. I'm not convinced it will last, but it's a great size for a 14 day business trip.
customer_reviews.author: SEC

customer_reviews.title: Good buy for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I don't travel a whole lot so I don't like spending a ton on luggage. When I go buy new sets I generally go for something like this and this is not my first Travel's Choice set. They can take a beating and remain strong. I haven't had any issues with mine and the color stand out nicely in baggage claim. No complaints!
customer_reviews.author: Donna C

customer_reviews.title: Must have for frequent flyers!
customer_reviews.text: I really liked the value of this suitcase. I had to replace an expensive suitcase that I had for 10 years and the manufacturer of the old suitcase was no longer in business. I researched and read reviews and eventually decided this was worth a try. I had upcoming flights for a vacation. I was happily surprised by the durability, space, and style of this suitcase. I believe it will last a long time. I travel very frequently and this was easy to maneuver through several airports. I highly recommend this item it’s cheaper but you don’t sacrifice durability.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Nice, in-between size case
customer_reviews.text: I bought this suitcase because I wanted something between my large unwieldy, pack enough stuff for a long winter trip, case and my roller, small enough for international regulations, carry on. I like how roomy but compact this 25 inch bag is, great for taking on trains. Having just got back from a three city European trip, I can also attest to its sturdiness. I do agree with other posters who recommend getting the darkest color—the fabric picks up dirt more than any of the other bags I check.
customer_reviews.author: DJN

customer_reviews.title: good zippers,  good material,  working handle .  Balanced
customer_reviews.text: i love this set. my mac air fits in the small one. and it still has room for a plane blanket and lunch and assundries. The larger one meets the new Alaska Air dimension requirements. The material is very durable . The handle works well. It stays balanced. I think I payed around $32. and was afraid it would be a cheap thing to be ashamed of . Instead the Rust color goes perfectly with my other favorite rollling duffle which also has been amazingly durable . It has a graffiti design , and the orange scrawls match this set perfectly
customer_reviews.author: margie

customer_reviews.title: Bucket List Trip Mishap
customer_reviews.text: I bought this luggage for a long anticipated trip to the Maritime Provinces in Canada. I thought is was great looking and I hoped it would last for a while. Unfortunately, that was not to be. I noticed, midway through my trip, there was a hole in the back of the bag. Since I stayed at 4 different hotels, in addition to the airport handling, there was no way to pinpoint where the damage occurred. I do know I don't carry any sharp objects in my luggage, so I'm sure the damage was from an external cause.
customer_reviews.author: CK1

customer_reviews.title: Good except for the wheels
customer_reviews.text: So there was a mix up with my order and I never received the smaller bag but I did get a partial refund and I can't complain for getting a rolling luggage for about $20 I think it ended up being. It works well, I have had no trouble at the airport and it fits perfectly in the overhead compartment. The wheels are my biggest complaint. If you turn it the wrong way then the entire bag will tip and that makes it hard to maneuver around corners. But for what I paid for and for how much I use it, I can't really complain too much.
customer_reviews.author: Sandra M.

customer_reviews.title: Gave me allergies and asthma. Absolutely gross.
customer_reviews.text: Gave me asthma. I think the one I. Ought was used despite saying new. It was covered in dog hair and gave me horrible allergies. I literally had to clean my house after receiving it. Unfortunately I am allergic to pet dander and you could actually see the hairs on the inside and out. Even if you aren’t allergic it’s seriously gross to pack your clothes I. Something like that. Spent 20 bucks more and get something that’s actually new because this was either used or stores in a warehouse with dogs in it.
customer_reviews.author: DanG

customer_reviews.title: Best in Customer Care
customer_reviews.text: I bought this suitcase and traveled to Miami within the next two weeks. When I collected my luggage in the Miami airport, I found that the airport luggage handling had split a seems on the front of the brand new suitcase. After completing my 3-week trip, I wrote to Traveler's Choice and explained the incident a few weeks ago. Today, I received a replacement suitcase from Traveler's Choice. What a stand-up customer care company!! I would not expect such excellent product support from lesser companies. Thank you, Traveler's Choice for your prompt response and outstanding support.
customer_reviews.author: Jack B

customer_reviews.title: Extremely cheap, decent if you can get one of them sent to you without having it damaged
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered 3 of these now. 2 of them came bent because of the poor packaging and build quality, but was able to bend one back into the correct shape. So now I have 2 of them. I don't expect them to last very long but they are really cheap and we rarely fly anywhere so I think they will be good enough for what I want them for. Don't expect quality luggage though if you buy these. The little lock that comes with it is laughably terrible. It's barely a toy and certainly won't stop anyone from getting in to the luggage.
customer_reviews.author: T. Noffy

customer_reviews.title: Who knew I could find such a substantial bag for less than 50 bucks
customer_reviews.text: This is a very sturdy piece of luggage. I did not buy it for a carry-on because the bins keep getting smaller anyway. It was checked and held plenty of clothes and shoes and more for a 7 day trip. The fabric is very nice looking and seems very rugged at the same time. Zippers are strong and the expansion is always handy. I would buy a set if I needed one. But this and the great backpack I also found at Amazon are all I need (Himawari Travel Backpack Laptop Backpack (Y1-VMB2-JPZX).
customer_reviews.author: Shopsalot

customer_reviews.title: Good for my trip
customer_reviews.text: I am not a traveler so I can't really compare this to other suit cases I may have used in the past. I seldom have a need for one. I needed a nice one, though, to see my son graduate the Air Force basic training and I had to fly there. This suitcase held up well, wasn't a real burden to pull, held everything I needed and more. The only thing is that it looks like a million other suit cases so you need to put a ribbon on or some other form of identification to find it quickly when it comes out on the baggage rack.
customer_reviews.author: JKL

customer_reviews.title: First flight out and it was torn. Second flight and another pice is broken.
customer_reviews.text: I like the size - the weight and the construction- but when it was delivered back to me, after one flight - it’s first flight - the rear cover was torn. The fabric appears to be just too lightweight to offer real life travel protection. Shame. A second trip and another item was damaged. Final trip home coming up - I will be contacting the manufacturer/ supplier as it has a six year warranty apparently. Currently I’d say this piece of luggage is not fit for purpose inside the US airline system.
customer_reviews.author: DTee

customer_reviews.title: Expandable Rolling Upright Luggage, Navy, Checked-Large 29-Inch
customer_reviews.text: I Bought This Because It Was Just Like The One I Wanted But It Was Smaller. Than Than My Original Luggage with Four Wheels Not Worth It So I Sent It Right Back. It Was Narrow And Shorter... Travel Select Amsterdam Expandable Rolling Upright Luggage, Navy, Checked-Large 29-Inch ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------ Thanks Scott
customer_reviews.author: Scott  Alpert

customer_reviews.title: Quality is equal to purchase price
customer_reviews.text: This is a relatively inexpensive set, and for the money, it was adequate to the trip I used it on (round trip from Seattle to Oakland). I checked the larger bag and took the smaller one onboard. It was a bit squirrelly when pulling it on the wheels, and fell over once when I set it upright beside me. But construction/durability was what I expected for the price. I don't do much travelling, so was satisfied with the purchase overall. If I travelled a lot, I would spend more to hopefully get more durability. Also, it came with keys but no lock. There doesn't seem to be a way to contact the seller about this omission.
customer_reviews.author: TJ in Kirkland

customer_reviews.title: I used these on two trips so far, fit ...
customer_reviews.text: I used these on two trips so far, fit in the overhead no issues, held together while running through SFO during my 30 min lay-over. I dig the color (70's style burnt orange) and the hand bag was big enough to fit my laptop, but I opted for my purse instead since I had no need for my laptop. The handle height is adjustable, but only has 2 settings.
customer_reviews.author: Erin Barney

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest.
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in this luggage set. Bought this set for my wife for her birthday and used the largest suitcase once and the internal mechanism for the handle is already broken. It is jammed inside and can no longer extend. I have had a Traveler's Choice hybrid hard shell/soft shell for years and love it. It was that positive experience that made we look seriously at this set.Very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: David Roush

customer_reviews.title: Seem to hold up well.
customer_reviews.text: We bought four of these suitcases for a trip to South America. I had some doubts about them because of their price and thought they might not hold up that well. We have now completed the trip and can confirm they held up well. This in spite of the fact that the airline delivered them late after routing them through Guatemala (which we did not visit). None of them showed any damage from the trip, so I would probably buy them again. The only minor problem is that they did get dirty on the orange surface which shows more than the black.
customer_reviews.author: Laker

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Considering the price this bag probably deserves a 5 star rating, but the quality is poor and it's already showing signs of wear and tear after using it on one trip. I love how the smaller bag fits right on top of the main bag and it's big enough for my lap top. It's ideal for business travel. I also love the orange color.
customer_reviews.author: JenTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you'd expect
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy construction. Rolls well. Basically does exactly what you'd expect it to do from looking at the preview images. The bonus personal bag is a nice touch. I use it to carry the things I want to have access to during my flight. (jacket, power bank, power cords, headphones, book, etc)
customer_reviews.author: Quarnozian

customer_reviews.title: False Delivery Notice, before package actually arrived
customer_reviews.text: I work at home, but am typically on phone calls when Amazon arrives. Usually I get a knock at the door to open up. The delivery notice popped up an hour before the item arrived. So it seemed as if it was stolen, or dropped at the wrong house. Made me panic, thinking it was taken. The item is fine, I ordered the same set a year ago. Great luggage, poor delivery today.
customer_reviews.author: joe zielbauer

customer_reviews.title: Attractive bags, does the job
customer_reviews.text: Nice luggage set. We have gone on one trip with the set so far. Everything held up pretty well, but suitcase that we checked was obviously scuffed up once we got to our destination. Airports are not gentle on luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Stardust

customer_reviews.title: Handle rivets on this bag are quite robust
customer_reviews.text: Purchased April 2018. I read the reviews complaining of flimsy handle attachment. The one I got is quite robust...no worries there. All in all, a great set for the price. One reviewer did note that the roller is a bit tippy, and I concur. Wheels are set a little deeper than the bottom feet/aux handle. If this becomes too much of a bother, a small adjustment with a grinder will make this a five star item. The smaller bag fits nicely over the roller extending handle and stays put well. Zippers are above average, though the little lock is a joke. Roller bag has a really nice interior liner. I'm quite happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: William Ward

customer_reviews.title: All the important features
customer_reviews.text: Bought it and immediately took it from DC to Seattle. Stood up just fine. Very basic, but with handles in the right places. Amazingly light weight. Not many pockets so I use ziplock baggies. Will be interesting to see if the zippers hold up. The expander could be a bit deeper. Only adds about 1 inch. Medium sized bag.
customer_reviews.author: The Old Fisherman

customer_reviews.title: Do Not BUY
customer_reviews.text: Didn't hold up well. I used the set on one trip to Florida, 2 of the bags came back split open. I would only suggest this set as a one time use or very light use. The handles are coming apart, too. They look nice, just not well made.
customer_reviews.author: todd m grenier

customer_reviews.title: My daughters birthday gift
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I bought this set for our daughter and she was as happy as a pig in mud.... LOL It is light weight and seems to roll just fine..... I must say that it is what was advertised but only after a few trips will tell her/us how durable the luggage is and how well the wheels will hold up...... First impression is a BIG thumbs up !!!
customer_reviews.author: BUG 1952

customer_reviews.title: Not very good or durable. Single use
customer_reviews.text: Not the best quality. When it arrived there were loose strings around the zippers that had to be cut off. I was afraid to pull then, fearing the zipper would come off like opening a bag of dog food. Came down the luggage carousel filthy. Maybe it was Delta, but it looks like a design issue. My wife’s new ebags case was fine. And, the zipper pull came off. It actually looks too crappy to donate to Goodwill. That I not dirt. Do not wash off. Looks like degraded under fabric. 😢😢😢
customer_reviews.author: Chester S

customer_reviews.title: Great Set!
customer_reviews.text: I am so thrilled by this set! Every size you could need for every trip PLUS those neat packing sets AND every suitcase and packing piece fits together so that all fit inside the largest case. Great for storing! Super quality. The orange is a nice deep orange color - not garishly bright. Cannot believe all this for that price!
customer_reviews.author: Swizylstik

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: Overstuffed the heck out of this thing on a 3-week trip through Europe. Planes, trains, automobiles--it saw them all. It is pretty basic and still was perfect for our needs. As it was so full, we checked it on the airlines--it would not have fit into the overhead with the zippered extension. But it was still small enough to fit in the trunk of every taxi and other cars along with several other bags.
customer_reviews.author: Twin Seasons Vacations

customer_reviews.title: The layout is nice, and it held enough for an 8 day ...
customer_reviews.text: When fully loaded it is front heavy, so it falls over - a lot. The badge on the front fell off after three baggage handings (1 flight, on the cruise, off the cruise) It isn't secured by anything other than metal tabs that are folded over inside the case. The layout is nice, and it held enough for an 8 day vacation. It is a popular bag so when traveling you might want to identify it in someway.
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: This suitcase is light and has a nice design. It is poorly finished though and I ...
customer_reviews.text: This suitcase is light and has a nice design. It is poorly finished though and I don't think it will last for too long. But for the price it has let's say it's OK. Mine came with one of the main zipper pull tabs missing. This was not noticeable at first because it is on the slider with the little lock and keys tied to it. I happen to have older bags with a similar system (and much better quality!!) so I removed a pull tab from one of them and attached it to the slider. The connection was too large so I tightened it. Not big deal but it shouldn't be like this!
customer_reviews.author: Daniela

customer_reviews.title: Good value. Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Good luggage, nice value. Don't fall for the high department store prices. I suspect they all come from the same factories and, besides, the airlines will lose it or crush it anyway (: We've had expensive stuff and value ones and they all seem to last about the same.
customer_reviews.author: RICKVOO

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.text: It holds stuff as a suitcase should and the price is right. Overall, it does the job. However, after only 6 flights, the bag is starting to look like it has been well-traveled. There are some seams fraying. The seams on the shoe holder broke on the first use. I have already had to use tape to cover a rip in the fabric. So, you get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: S. Green

customer_reviews.title: Looks good... that's about it.
customer_reviews.text: Started falling apart after one trip. One of the pull handles is already starting to bend. Great if you are handling your luggage, but if you flying you can expect it will get damaged since it isn't strong.
customer_reviews.author: Annonymous

customer_reviews.title: Well made and a good size
customer_reviews.text: The price is great and I love the size of it. I wanted something larger than my 21" suitcase but, still small enough for me to handle as someone not even 5' tall. It works really well, though I wish it had 4 wheels that go in any direction, then it would be perfect.The stand opposit the wheels scratches up easily, it scratched up the first time I used it. The zippers are well made, I filled it up to the brim three times with no issue and manhandled it up some staircases.
customer_reviews.author: Yesenia

customer_reviews.title: I love the color
customer_reviews.text: Make sure the size is what you were looking for, because they are smaller than I expected, but thats my fault for not paying closer attention. I love the color, high quality, lining unzips-can be used as hidden compartment. Even with the smaller size I rolled my clothes, and fit everything for one week in Toronto (September weather)
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Khan

customer_reviews.title: Baggage Handling
customer_reviews.text: Construction is very good. Made in USA. Consumer reports warns against Chinese-made products as being shoddy. This one has plenty of metal supports. I made only one round trip with it so far as checked baggage, which involved a one stop transfer between airports. The suitcase still looks brand new. Be careful of evaluating negative reviews, when the cause might be due to faulting handling by baggage loading personell.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis F.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality. I can't belive how little it cost
customer_reviews.text: I am impressed with the quality of this suitcase. The orange one was on sale so I bought it considering I don't care what color it was. I actually like the color a lot. It appears the same in person as it did online.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey Reyes

customer_reviews.title: ZIPPER BROKE AFTER TWO TRIPS
customer_reviews.text: There is a lot of hype about these bags, but an outside zipper broke and all toiletries were lost on the second trip. Headed for the trash can unless the seller provide support on the issue. I thought the reviews were too good to believe and they were.
customer_reviews.author: Scott B.

customer_reviews.title: Served the purpose
customer_reviews.text: I did like how lightweight this luggage is. I probably should say it is not the manufacturing of the luggage that was an issue, but the way airline baggage carries don't care how they handle it. After returning home, it was totally scuffed and looked like it was dragged on the material side around the tarmac! It was easy to wash.
customer_reviews.author: Charlene  M Clark

customer_reviews.title: 4 stars just because the overall quality isn't great, after 2 trips the bag is very beat ...
customer_reviews.text: It does the trick, it's very large, the wheels/handle work. No issues with the zippers. 4 stars just because the overall quality isn't great, after 2 trips the bag is very beat up and I may have to retire it after it's 3rd.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend this suitcase!
customer_reviews.text: I loved this suitcase! I ordered two for a family vacation and they were great. We got them through the cruise terminals easily and they were lightweight enough that my 7 year old could pull the suitcase with ease. They were big enough for me and my husband to pack everything for a four day cruise with room to spare. The pockets in the front are perfect for small items, or paperwork/ boarding passes. Best of all, the price was great for the quality of the product.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Stanford

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than it looks.
customer_reviews.text: Looks durable but was smaller than I thought it would be when compared with the luggage I already have. The height is okay (but it's not quite 22 inches) but the width and depth are smaller than I expected. Probably good for a weekend trip but don't think I can get as much in it as my other suitcases. Color is definitely orange and not red. Returned it due to the shallow depth and width.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Lambert

customer_reviews.title: Great suitcase for overnight or carry-on
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size for carry on luggage or simply for an overnight trip to the coast. Very well made suitcase and shoulder bag; unisex travel bags with all the pouches and pockets you’ll need. I love these bags-I bought it for my husband and kept it for myself!
customer_reviews.author: CINDY L BRANSON

customer_reviews.title: Didn't know what to expect, but very happy ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't know what to expect because of some negative reviews, but very happy with this suitcase. Used it for a 5-week trip to the Caribbean and it worked great. Holds a lot, fit our airline specs, no sign of wear or tear.
customer_reviews.author: Bastian

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy enough for airline checked baggage.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this suitcase because I needed more space for a longer trip. At first glance, it seemed to fit the need. However, on the first trip expandable handle got bent - when it was retracted inside the suitcase. I really don't think it was due to airline handling - the handle is just too light to withstand a trip on the conveyor belt. I WOULD NOT RECOMMEND this suitcase if you intend to check the bag. If not traveling via air, it should be ok. All in all, don't buy for airline travel. It is not sturdy enough for an airline conveyor belt.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than expected
customer_reviews.text: I knew something was wrong immediately when I saw the shipping box. It looks big (maximum carry-on size) but it would fit INSIDE my old carry-on tote. It would be okay I suppose for a child. The wheels didn't spin freely and the plastic around the corners didn't fit tightly giving the product a very cheap feel. Sent it back. It looks much nicer in the pictures than in reality.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: It would be perfect for a weekend
customer_reviews.text: It fit everything I neede for clothes but not all the cosmetics, shampoos, hair dryer and "STUFF" a woman needs. I used it for a formal event away from home, so there were al ot of extras to bring. It would be perfect for a weekend. It didn't stand up on its own when it was full. You need to lean it on something, but for the price, this was no inconvenience at all. For the price it is the bag you want for a quick getaway.
customer_reviews.author: Debra

customer_reviews.title: Perfect price
customer_reviews.text: We lug a super heavy car seat around airports & usually strap it to borrowed suitcases. Was a little worried this one wouldn’t be able to handle the weight all the way from parking to baggage check, but it was a champ just like our toddler. Probably won’t last forever, but we’ll be back to carrying packs by then. If you travel a lot, might not be the best option. We take 2 to 3 trips a year using this bag & it works great for us.
customer_reviews.author: P. P.

customer_reviews.title: Why did I get an unmatched set... it’s not what I ordered.
customer_reviews.text: I’m a little confused, I ordered the navy and Amazon showed 4 pieces of navy luggage by this vendor. When I opened it, to my surprise, the two inner pieces (the smallest sizes), were orange. It’s ridiculous to o have to return it, but all seriousness, I wanted my set to match. Just received it today, so I’m not sure on the durability. To the Vendor... how will you make this right? I’d really like the rest of my navy pieces. Thank you
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Good choice if you aren't a heavy road warrior
customer_reviews.text: Good choice if you aren't a heavy road warrior. I've taken it on two trips so far and I like it, but I wouldn't expect it to last for years. Still a decent choice if you don't want to spend too much. This size is larger than carry on. Has a dark navy blue face and black sides and back, so doesnt stand out on the carousel, but identifiable IF the airport people don't load it face down. Overall nice appearance.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: The larger carry-on worked great in getting up in bin of American Airlines plane
customer_reviews.text: The larger carry-on worked great in getting up in bin of American Airlines plane, and the $25 which would have been charged for check-in of it or a larger bag to and from my destination was saved and paid for these items. Haven't needed to use the smaller bag yet, but it may have some use in the future. I wish that the two outside pockets were instead one larger pocket so that a magazine or larger booklet would fit, and likewise two of the mesh pockets on inside were one, but that's no big deal.
customer_reviews.author: P. Eftink

customer_reviews.title: Great piece of luggage!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 2 of these for my teens to take on our 7 day family vacation. They held all of the clothes they needed, plus toiletries bag and a pair of shoes. They held up great and seem to be a great quality. I would definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: K.Rich

customer_reviews.title: Smaller than I thought, short skids.
customer_reviews.text: The roller bag was smaller than I thought it would be. I measured the my old one from the size of the compartment that was 21" this one is measured as total length. I like the strap on the top to hold another piece of luggage, the smaller travel bag was nice too. If I was going to do this again I would just get the full set instead of these two bags. The skids are not very long so it does get caught on stairs when I just pull it up, once and a while depending on the stairs.
customer_reviews.author: GeekStick

customer_reviews.title: DELTA did it in the very first time I used it.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't see it at first - - who looks at the back of their luggage. When I got home I was emptying the luggage and discovered about a six inch tear in the back of the luggage. I have tried to repair it but don't know if this will suffice. Highly suggest (after this) that whoever reads this should get the insurance. I did not because the other luggage I bought from this site was great - - until the zippers were "totaled" by the airlines BUT it did take several years for them to do it.
customer_reviews.author: 0210 loggie

customer_reviews.title: No good for more than a couple of trips
customer_reviews.text: Very flimsy and fragile, frame not sturdy enough for the amount of weight one can pack in it. Deformed after first trip, wheels coming undone after second, I doubt it will survive third. Also not the least water resistant: checked it in on a rainy day to find the top layer of clothes soaked. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: RF

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh my goodness!! These are so wonderful and for such a great price. I was a little hesitant about buying luggage online.. And some reviews were bad. But these are wonderful suitcases and I really believe they will last a long time.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Burton

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed with this item
customer_reviews.text: I was very pleased with the overall durability and manageability of this luggage item. I took it on a trip immediately after purchasing it, and it was a breeze! I love the fact that it expands, so there's plenty of room for souvenirs
customer_reviews.author: Ruth Riley

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: When I saw this luggage I thought it would be perfect for my upcoming vacation. In the picture it shows a person rolling it sideways. Or at least it's what I thought. It DOES NOT ROLL SIDEWAYS!! However the luggage itself looks very nice and we'll made
customer_reviews.author: NanSee1082

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: Excellent and attractive piece of luggage. Has withstood the test of time. This was a very much appreciated gift.
customer_reviews.author: Reader Extraordinaire

customer_reviews.title: Not a Spinner!
customer_reviews.text: This suitcase was sent as a gift to a friend going on a cruise with me. When I saw it I thought it appeared different than the one pictured and looked about 40 years old. The color looked faded. This is not a spinner suitcase - it rolls backwards and forward. No twirlies. I can see why it was marked down, but my friend was happy to get it.
customer_reviews.author: Jane M. Howard

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: Used for Christmas travel. It is nice and so far so good. Wish there where nicer colors to choose from. Made me laugh this is obviously a suitcase and the mailman left for his details, package left in residence mailbox lol lol. No matter how hard one might try there’s no way this could even come close to fitting in my mailbox haha.
customer_reviews.author: arlc

customer_reviews.title: Handle BROKE before trip destination!
customer_reviews.text: First trip, on first flight, the handle broke as I was lifting it into the overhead compartment....unbelievable! It never had time to be broken into...it just simply broke.
customer_reviews.author: Truth Be Told

customer_reviews.title: Handle broke (first use, at home, only 20lbs of stuff in the suitcase)
customer_reviews.text: The handle on this thing broke the first time I put 20 lbs of clothing in it and picked it up. Unfortunately, I don't have time to trade it in for a product that isn't broken since I leave tomorrow for a trip and by the time I get back the airlines will have done a number on it. Basically, I picked the suitcase up by the handle and one of the rivets slipped out of place. Wasted money on something that didn't even get out the door before it could no longer be used properly. Would return if I didn't need it starting tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Reatha

customer_reviews.title: Retractable handle broken after 1 use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a 2nd piece of the Amsterdam collection The 1st piece (large) had to be exchanged after 1 use also as it ripped. Now this piece, unable to be used until now due to COVID travel restrictions, has the retractable handle broken as the housing inside seems to be bent! Very poorly made luggage. Would not recommend. Now I don't think I can return as out of time frame????
customer_reviews.author: K.F.

customer_reviews.title: Manufacturing defect
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Travelers Choice 2-piece Burgundy set on October 1. 2019. I have only used it once to go to Vancouver in Canada. When I came home, I have noticed 1/3 of the front right handle for the small traveler's bag came off from the main bag. This is obviously the manufacturing defect. I contacted the company right away. They gave me the warranty support ticket# and said they will contact me within 72 hours, but it has not happened yet. I am very disappointed with this bag and this company.
customer_reviews.author: Kimiko Chevalier

customer_reviews.title: Handling
customer_reviews.text: Did not like that there were not 4 spin wheels. I am a senior and only 2 wheels make it a little hard to maneuver. I should have paid more attention to this when I purchased this. Otherwise I like the price for weight and all I could pack.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda Pursley

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 8 months
customer_reviews.text: Got this 8 months ago. Have taken it on maybe 3 trips. The handle is already busted and won't come up because it's bent. It happened somehow when checking the baggage, and I know TSA can be rough sometimes, but it's a suitcase, so it should be able to withstand more than 3 airplane rides. Pretty bummed
customer_reviews.author: Alex Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: Good sturdy luggage
customer_reviews.text: This case completes my 4 piece set. Had the carry on for a few years and gradually purchased the other three cases. Has held up well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Syl Flower

customer_reviews.title: Don't spend too much. The airlines are going to eventually lose or crush your case anyway. Just buy these and don't worry.
customer_reviews.text: Good value for the money. I've had inexpensive and expensive luggage and they're all basically the same. Same fabrics, same hardware for the most part. Don't fall for the department store high prices. This 25" size is modest. If you need a big case get the Travelers Choice 29" size. Big enough for my wife's stuff. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: RICKVOO

customer_reviews.title: Arrived dirty
customer_reviews.text: Just got this today and I opened the box and this is what it looked like.
customer_reviews.author: Norma

customer_reviews.title: Didn't get what was expected
customer_reviews.text: Have not used yet. Because of the picture I thought I was getting the small duffel with the mid size luggage, however, it was the duffel and the smallest luggage which is not likely to be big enough for the cruise
customer_reviews.author: Kimba

customer_reviews.title: Nice Set
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these at a very reasonable price. They room is not too loud, it's just what I needed, something casual and trendy at the same time. I took them on my most recent vacation, there was no issue finding them except when they're turned to the back. I saw other travelers with their luggage falling apart but thankfully these held up with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: VisioN

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size & Price
customer_reviews.text: Very light & compact. Especially when airlines charge their passengers $70 for each checked in luggage over 50lb limit. Not including measurement restrictions. Perfect size & price as described. Grey color not too silver, grey color not too charcoal nor grey color not too platinum. Passed travel test. Southwest Airlines from Chicago to Ontario.
customer_reviews.author: JW_Redlands

customer_reviews.title: Is great for short trips.
customer_reviews.text: Used it on a cruise vacation. Had to get through traveling to TX by plane and being loaded and unloaded to the ship and then there was all the mistreatment I give it, and did just fine I will continue to use this suitcase for short trips, but for longer ones I will be buying a suitcase with four wheels.
customer_reviews.author: MizzDe

customer_reviews.title: Would not recommend this luggage at all
customer_reviews.text: I used this for one trip. Didn't even make it through the flight and the bottom is ripped. I only had 4 outfit and my shower items in the luggage, not overstuffed at all and can't get ahold of support to file for a replacement or money back. Would not recommend this luggage at all.
customer_reviews.author: ay30

customer_reviews.title: Very durable
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over 5 years and it's still intact. This suitcase has been with me across different parts of the U.S. and to different continents. If you need to travel somewhere for a week, this is the perfect amount of space.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

product_meta.title: Travel Select Amsterdam Expandable Rolling Upright Luggage, Navy, Checked-Medium 25-Inch
product_meta.description: Size:Checked-Medium 25-Inch| Color:NavyTravel in sturdy and affordable style with this 25-inch expandable rolling luggage by Travel Select. This deluxe set features expandability on all upright cases. It is made of superior two-tone polyester fabrication with PVC backing. It features inline skate wheels and an internal retractable push-button handle system for rolling ease and comfort. It has multiple front zippered pockets. It has an add-a-bag strap and clasp for toting an additional bag. Product Dimensions: 25” H x 15” W x 9” D (expands to 11 in. D).
feature_bullets: Made of superior and durable 1200D 2-tone polyester with PVC backing
Push-button locking internal retractable handle system and add-a-bag strap and clasp for toting additional bag easily
Elegantly fully imprinted interior lining with elastic tie-down straps and large interior zippered mesh lid pocket and dual shoe pockets
Product Dimensions: 25” H x 15” W x 9” D (expands to 11 in. D)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars3,731 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
